title: Israeli strikes kill scores in Gaza as Egypt offers new ceasefire proposal
byline: Israeli strikes across the Gaza Strip killed more than 65 Palestinians over the past day, including women and children, the Gaza Health Ministry said Monday.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Southern and Northwestern provinces after 2.00 p.m.

title: 10 Bangladeshis arrested in Katunayake for visa overstay, illegal migration attempt
byline: A group of 10 Bangladeshi nationals, who had entered Sri Lanka illegally with the intention of fleeing to Europe, have been arrested by the Investigation Division of the Immigration and Emigration Department on the afternoon of March 24 in the Andiambalama area of Katunayake.

title: Another suspect arrested over Devundara double murder
byline: Police have arrested another suspect in connection with the fatal shooting incident that took place in Devundara in the Gandara Police Division on March 21, that killed two persons.

title: Govt to reduce tariffs paid for rooftop solar power
byline: The government has decided to revise the tariff paid per unit of electricity generated by rooftop solar panels, with the proposed rates set to vary based on the scale of energy production.

title: Plane turns around after pilot forgets passport
byline: A United Airlines 787 flying from Los Angeles to China had to turn around this weekend after it was discovered one of the pilots had taken off without their passport, the airline told CNN in a statement.

title: Samsung co-CEO Han Jong-Hee dies at 63
byline: Samsung Electronics co-CEO Han Jong-Hee died from cardiac arrest on Tuesday, according to a spokesperson for the South Korean tech giant.

title: No tax revisions on vehicle imports this year - Hulangamuwa
byline: Senior Economic Advisor to the President, Duminda Hulangamuwa, confirmed that there will be no revision of taxes on vehicle imports this year.

title: South Korea fights deadly wildfires in southeast as thousands evacuate
byline: South Korea is struggling to contain wildfires ravaging the country’s southeast after more than two dozen blazes broke out over the weekend, killing four people and forcing thousands to evacuate.

title: ‘Will you defend them now?’ – Namal questions govt. over UK sanctions on war heroes
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa has strongly condemned the UK’s decision to impose sanctions on senior Sri Lankan military figures who played a pivotal role in defeating terrorism.

title: Police receive more election-related complaints
byline: The Police Headquarters has issued a special statement regarding reports of election law violations and acts of violence related to the upcoming local government elections.

title: Ex-IGP Deshabandu allowed to receive home-cooked meals
byline: Former Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon, who is currently in remand custody, has been granted permission to receive food prepared from his home while being detained at the Dumbara Prison in Kandy.

title: Magnitude 6.7 quake shakes New Zealand’s South Island
byline: A strong 6.7 magnitude earthquake struck off New Zealand’s South Island on Tuesday, authorities said, as the country’s disaster agency assessed if there were any tsunami threats.

title: Water cut for several areas in Gampaha District on Thursday
byline: An eight-and-a-half-hour water cut will be imposed in several areas of Gampaha District on Thursday (March 27), the National Water Supply & Drainage Board (NWSDB) announced.

title: Govt loses Rs. 78.15M due to uncharged motorcycle registration fees – COPA reveals
byline: It has been revealed at the Committee on Public Accounts (COPA) that due to the failure to charge the prescribed fees for the registration of 296 motorcycles falling under the engine capacity category of 201 to 450cc, the government has incurred a loss of Rs. 78.15 million, the Parliamentary Communications Department stated in a statement.

title: iPhone 17: What to expect from new series in September
byline: The next-generation iPhone series is expected to introduce significant upgrades beyond the usual annual Apple Silicon refresh and iOS update.

title: No-confidence motion against Deshabandu Tennakoon
byline: A group of MPs of the National People’s Power (NPP) are set to submit a no-confident motion against suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon today (25).

title: EC announces nomination period for three Pradeshiya Sabhas
byline: The Election Commission has issued an announcement regarding the acceptance of nominations for the Poonakari, Mannar, and Dehiattakandiya Pradeshiya Sabha elections.

title: Yoshitha and wife arrive to provide statements over night club brawl
byline: Yoshitha Rajapaksa and his wife have arrived at the Kompanna Veediya Police Station to provide statements regarding a brawl that took place in front of a nightclub in Colombo on Saturday (22) night.

title: Oscar-winning Palestinian director attacked by Israeli settlers and detained by army
byline: Israeli settlers beat up one of the Palestinian co-directors of the Oscar-winning documentary film “ No Other Land ” on Monday in the occupied West Bank before he was detained by the Israeli military, according to two of his fellow directors and other witnesses.

title: CPC to export lubricants to Bangladesh within two months
byline: Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) Chairman D.J. Rajakaruna stated that that plans are in place to begin exporting lubricating oil within the next two months.

title: Five-member team to visit Sri Lanka to meet imprisoned TN fishermen
byline: A five-member team from Tamil Nadu will travel to Sri Lanka to meet with Indian fishermen imprisoned in Sri Lankan jails and make arrangements for their release, Indian media reported.

title: Recent shooting incidents do not threaten national security – Dy Defense Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Defense Aruna Jayasekara assured that the recent shooting incidents reported across the country do not pose a threat to national security.

title: Govt. asked to disclose ongoing development projects during election period
byline: The Election Commission has informed the government to provide details of ongoing development projects during the election period.

title: 2024 Legends League match-fixing: Indian manager gets 4-year jail term, fined Rs. 85M
byline: The Matale High Court has sentenced the Manager of the Kandy Samp Army franchise in the 2024 Legends League, Akash (Yogi) Patel, in absentia to four years of imprisonment for match-fixing.

title: NPP MPs submit letter proposing removal of Deshabandu Tennakoon
byline: A group of Parliamentarians of the National People’s Power (NPP) has handed over a letter proposing the removal of suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon, to the Speaker of the House.
